Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York  10013.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Brewer.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 28, 2004 be adopted as printed by Council Member Barron.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 98-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the prohibition on the sale, lease, rental or operation of motorized scooters.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto of Int. 98-A, Prohibition on sale, lease, rental or operation of motorized scooters.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Lisa A. Gomez to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment as a member of the City Planning Commission, pursuant to Sections 31 and 192 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Lisa A. Gomez, City Planning Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Emily S. Heinze to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment as a member of the Environmental Control Board, pursuant to Sections 31 and 1404 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Emily S. Heinze, Environmental Control Board

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 040501 PCM, 040502 PCM, site selections shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, W. 29th - W. 30th St., Manhattan (040501PCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Education

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York City Police Department to provide information to the City Council regarding school safety agents.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYPD and DOE to conduct an annual review and assessment of the need for school safety agents at each school operated by the DOE.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Finance
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of the Forest Avenue business improvement district.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Introduction be Approved by Council.
Items.MatterName: Forest Avenue BID, Staten Island

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the extension of the Madison Avenue Business Improvement District in the Borough of Manhattan and setting the date, time and place for a further public hearing to hear all persons interested in the extension of such district as revised to exclude a property.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Resolution be Approved, by Council.
Items.MatterName: Extension of the Madison Avenue BID in the Borough of Manhattan.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Congress of the United States to pass S.2968, the “Emergency Flu Response Act of 2004”, introduced on October 8, 2004, by a bipartisan group of Senators, which would address the crisis created by the current shortage of flu vaccine.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committe on Health
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: “Emergency Flu Response Act of 2004”

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Legislature of the State of New York to amend the Real Property Tax Law to provide rent increase exemptions to qualified disabled heads of households modeled on the Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption (SCRIE) program.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption (SCRIE) program.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting comprehensive programs for the diagnosis and treatment of Hepatitis C, and educational efforts for substance abusers and persons with psychiatric disabilities who are substance abusers in order to stem the current epidemic of Hepatitis C infections.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Supporting comprehensive programs for the diagnosis and treatment of Hepatitis C.

Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Rules of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be filed.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.MatterName: Safety and effectiveness of prescribing antidepressants to children and adolescents.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills

Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to authorizing the department of transportation to extend the expiration date of any franchise to operate and maintain bus stop shelters.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the DOT to extend the expiration date of any franchise to operate and maintain bus shelters.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the license application requirements for general and food street vendors and to repeal paragraph 7 of subdivision b of section 17-309 and paragraph 6 of subdivision b of section 20-455 of the administrative code of the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: License application requirements for general and food street vendors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a child welfare parent advocate advisory committee.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Establishing a child welfare parent advocate advisory program and a child welfare parent advocate advisory board.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon all relevant City agencies to use their funding and regulatory power to support and encourage the provision of affordable high-speed Internet service and computer purchases for the benefit of residents of affordable housing.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology in Government due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Support and encourage the provision of affordable high-speed Internet service and computer purchases for the benefit of residents of affordable housing.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to ensuring a minimum level of gifted and talented programs in public schools.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Ensuring a minimum level of gifted and talented programs in public schools.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the 40th anniversary of the opening of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the 40th anniversary of the opening of the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and the Mayor to address the Metropolitan Transportation Authority’s projected budget deficit in 2005 to ensure that the proposed service cuts and fare hikes do not fall on the backs of transit riders or transit workers.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Address the MTA’s projected budget deficit in 2005.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a “no wake area” within the Harlem River and requiring appropriate signage, requiring the preparation and distribution of educational material about wake reduction and establishing a temporary citywide boater safety and wake reduction task force.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Creating vessel regulation zones within the Harlem River.

Items.Title: Resolution commending the 20th Anniversary of the program, COP SHOT (Citizens Outraged at Police Being Shot).
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Commending the 20th Anniversary of the program, COP SHOT (Citizens Outraged at Police Being Shot).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the composition of the Voter Assistance Commission.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Composition of the Voter Assistance Commission.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the appropriate committee of the Council of the city of New York to address the policy that Central Park cannot be used for political rallies.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Address the policy that Central Park cannot be used for political rallies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the requirement that all bicycles be registered with the department of transportation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Requirement that all bicycles be registered with the department of transportation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to boarding kennels, businesses or establishments.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Boarding kennels, businesses or establishments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in one business improvement district and one special assessment district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in one business improvement district and one special assessment district.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Assembly to pass A.2242, which would amend the Real Property Tax Law to provide that the definition of income be offset by any unreimbursed medical and prescription drug expenses paid by a senior citizen for purposes of determining eligibility for Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption (SCRIE) benefits, and further urging the New York State Senate to introduce and pass a companion bill.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Amend the Real Property Tax Law to exclude from the definition of income all unreimbursed medical and prescription drug expenses paid by a senior citizen. (A.6518)

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the extension of the Madison Avenue Business Improvement District in the Borough of Manhattan and setting the date, time and place for a further public hearing to hear all persons interested in the extension of such district as revised to exclude a property.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Extension of the Madison Avenue BID in the Borough of Manhattan.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to increasing fines for violations of the law for illegal dumping along Waterfront property into New York City waterways.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Waterfronts due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Increasing fines for violations of the law for illegal dumping along Waterfront property into NYC waterways.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Governor George E. Pataki and the New York State Legislature to enact legislation that would waive tuition and fees at City University of New York institutions for New York City residents who are either disabled military veterans or the children, spouses or dependents of such veterans.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education due back on 11/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Waive tuition and fees at CUNY Institutions for NYC who are either disabled military veterans or the children, spouses or dependents of such veterans.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the Department of Education, in consultation with the New York City Police Department, to install security cameras at New York City public schools.
Items.MatterName: DOE and NYPD to install video security cameras at all entrance and exit doors of each NYC public school.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the police department and the department of education to provide the public with information regarding school violence.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Introduction be Approved by Council.
Items.MatterName: Provide the public with information regarding school violence.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York City Police Department to provide information to the City Council regarding school safety agents.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYPD and DOE to conduct an annual review and assessment of the need for school safety agents at each school operated by the DOE.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the Department of Education, in consultation with the New York City Police Department, to install security cameras at New York City public schools.
Items.MatterName: DOE and NYPD to install video security cameras at all entrance and exit doors of each NYC public school.
